definition: to choke on (food etc)/to swallow the wrong way
to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: It's a wonder, really, the Queen didn't choke on her Cornflakes.
sentences.chinese: 这真是奇迹，女王在吃玉米片早餐时没有呛到。

sentences.english: Born under the water, is it possible to choke?
sentences.chinese: 宝宝在水中出生，会不会被水呛到？

sentences.english: Try not to chock on your own drool .
Practice until you can do it easily, and without so much force that you choke.
sentences.chinese: 在您能熟练掌握前请多加练习，否则很容易呛到。

sentences.english: And, don't ever swallow pool water.

definition: to choke (because of swallowing the wrong way)
to irritate the nose/to choke (of smoke, smell etc)/pungent/(coll.) (Tw) to shout at sb/to scold/to speak out against sb
sound of sighing/(interjection expressing surprise, sorrow, regret, disappointment etc) oh/damn/wow
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
